Leaving upwards of 12 per cent profit on the cost, at
$1,000,000 ; and this, without taking into the calculation
many minor articles. The estimate of the number of passengers is too low. Since making it, I have ascertained
that the steamboats navigating the Bayou Teche alone,
have carried, since the 8th of January last, about six thousand passengers, to and fro.
An extension of the road forty-one miles from Opelousas,
will meet the Railroad from Alexandria to Bayou Bceuf, by
which a great portion of the travel and trade from the valley of the Red River may be obtained ; an extension of one
hundred or one hundred and twenty miles will reach the
border of Texas, in a central position, that will secure an
immense trade, and induce the immigrants to that flourishing
state to take this route.
Having to the Seven Parishes Mentioned.—The 72,000
hogsheads of sugar, 30.000 hogsheads of molasses, and the
20,000 bales of cotton is worth about $5,120,000. The
saving in freight as compared with present prices, will
be $108,000
Insurance on the sugar molasses and cotton, at
present rates 51,200
Insurance on back freight and other articles 51,200
Estimate for articles that can then be brought to
market that cannot now 50.000
Making $260,400
Giving a clear gain to the producing classes in these seven
